text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.

- Prince Saidi of Saudi Arabia bought the bottled water company Frize, based in Tras-os-Montes in northern Portugal, for 1.2 billion escudos. The prince plans to invest 10 to 20 billion escudos in Portugal in the financial, real estate and water sectors.
- State television network RTP reduced its costs by 3.5 percent in 1996 and focused its investments on upgrading communications equipment.

- The European Commission has opened an investigation against the Portuguese state following a complaint from pharmaceutical company Astra accusing the national medicines institute of failing to suspend the sale of medicines suspected of having entered Portugal bearing documents of other products.
- Prime Minister Antonio Guterres has backed Agriculture Minister Fernando Gomes da Silva after the minister angered farmers with remarks about the competitiveness of Portuguese agriculture.

- State electricity company EDP-Electricidade de Portugal and the U.S. company AirTouch have suspended talks on the possible purchase by EDP of a 20 percent stake in mobile phone company Telecel, the newspaper learned. One reason for the suspension of the talks is that the price of the Telecel shares was considered too high.
- Alianca/UAP will sell from next year insurance products in branches of retail chain Pao de Acucar, which belongs to French retailer Auchan.
